intro: Sophora flavescens var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf Chinese槐, is a perennial shrub native to East Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is known for its medicinal properties, with roots containing alkaloids used in traditional Chinese medicine. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shrubland habitats. Its ecological role includes nitrogen fixation, benefiting surrounding plant life.
